oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Two unidentified Federal officers

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soldiers; Military uniforms
United States - History - Civil War, 1861-1865; Tennessee - History - Civil War, 1861-1865
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Full-length portrait of two Federal soldiers in uniform. One is standing with his right hand in his tunic, and one is seated with a sword across his lap and his right hand in his tunic.

Federal Brevet Brigadier General Gilbert Motier Lafayette Johnson, commander of the 13th Indiana Cavalry, had numerous cartes de visite of fellow men-in-arms among his papers; only a few are identified.
